text: Max Gallo (; 7 January 1932 – 18 July 2017) was a French writer, historian and politician. His parents were Italian immigrants. Gallo's early career was in journalism. At the time he was a Communist (until 1956). In 1974, he joined the Socialist Party. On April 26, 2007, he became a candidate to become a member of the Académie française. He was elected to the Académie française on 31 May 2007. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from laryngeal cancer Category:Cancer deaths in France Category:French historians Category:French journalists Category:Socialist Party (France) politicians Category:Politicians from Nice
